ermhes82 wrote:
> Thanks Gordon but I cannot login yet. Can you give me your sheets for 
> I check it?

Here's an excerpt from the configuration that worked for me on the 
mangosproject.org website:

root:credential-store=primary, 
org.archive.modules.credential.CredentialStore
root:credential-store:credentials=map, 
org.archive.modules.credential.Credential
root:credential-store:credentials:redhatsso=object, 
org.archive.modules.credential.HtmlFormCredential
root:credential-store:credentials:redhatsso:credential-domain=string, 
www.mangosproject.org
root:credential-store:credentials:redhatsso:form-items=map, java.lang.String
root:credential-store:credentials:redhatsso:form-items:UserName=string, 
MYTESTLOGIN
root:credential-store:credentials:redhatsso:form-items:PassWord=string, 
MYPASSWORD
root:credential-store:credentials:redhatsso:form-items:CookieDate=string, 1
root:credential-store:credentials:redhatsso:form-method=string, POST
root:credential-store:credentials:redhatsso:login-uri=string, 
http://www.mangosproject.org/forum/index.php?act=Login&CODE=01


> Also I have the same problem in this URL:
> http://www.javahispano.org/user.loginform.action
> 
> What is happening? My credentials are the following:
> root:credential-store=primary, 
> org.archive.modules.credential.CredentialStore
> root:credential-store:credentials=map, 
> org.archive.modules.credential.Credential
> root:credential-store:credentials:login=object, 
> org.archive.modules.credential.HtmlFormCredential
> root:credential-store:credentials:login:credential-domain=string, 
> www.javahispano.org
> root:credential-store:credentials:login:form-items=map, 
> java.lang.String
> root:credential-store:credentials:login:form-items:j_username=string, 
> myuser
> root:credential-store:credentials:login:form-items:j_password=string, 
> mypassword
> root:credential-store:credentials:login:form-items:j_remember=string, 
> 1
> root:credential-store:credentials:login:form-items:enter=string, 
> Entrar
> root:credential-store:credentials:login:form-method=string, POST
> root:credential-store:credentials:login:login-uri=string, 
> http://www.javahispano.org/user.loginform.action

I don't know what's wrong here; it would have to be something specific 
to that site. The login capability may not work everywhere, in 
particular if the server expects other cookies or form values with 
dynamic names, or does any other checking to prevent a client that looks 
like a robot from logging in. You may want to closely examine the 
headers from a successful browser login, using a tool like "Live 
Headers" for Firefox, and compare it with the response the crawler 
receives.

- Gordon @ IA
